subject: Re: [junit] Some queries about  jwebunit.........
msgSnippet: ... This sounds very strange. Please show us the command you use to run jWebUnit. Since jWebUnit is just an HTTP client and a bunch of assertions built on
messageBody:
amitbonde1982 wrote:
>
>
> i am new to the field of automated testing.
>
> i tried the sample test given in the documents of jwebunit.
> i compiled and run it from command prompt.
>
> i think it runs successfully as it does not throw any error, but it
> also does not indicate the results.
>
> how do i collect the results?
>
> also wanted to ask about ant maven, are they necessary for
> installing jwebunit?
>
> Please help..

This sounds very strange. Please show us the command you use to run
jWebUnit. Since jWebUnit is "just" an HTTP client and a bunch of
assertions built on top of JUnit, I can't imagine why you wouldn't get
test results: when running tests, it's the same as plain JUnit.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
